result.execSummary:
The defendant Jackson James Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
DE pleads No Contest to Ct #2.  Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:  358 days county jail with credit for 254 days served.  Fine/costs totalling $1079.25.   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $250 surcharge. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  
Counts #1 and 3 are dismissed but read in.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jackson James Merrill in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jackson James Merrill in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct #2.  Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:  358 days county jail with credit for 254 days served.  Fine/costs totalling $1079.25.   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $250 surcharge. Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  
Counts #1 and 3 are dismissed but read in.
